parsedComplaintsResult.impact: Premature brake rotor failure can lead to reduced braking performance, increased stopping distances, and potentially cause accidents.
symptoms: rust ridges and pitting on the rotors

parsedComplaintsResult.impact: Brake hydraulic system failure can cause the brake pedal to go to the floor, resulting in extended stopping distances and potentially leading to accidents.
symptoms: Brake pedal goes to the floor
and brake pedal feels soft or spongy.

parsedComplaintsResult.impact: Ball joint failure can cause loss of vehicle control, leading to accidents.
Power assist brake system failure can cause the brake pedal to feel hard or spongy, leading to reduced braking performance and potentially causing accidents.
symptoms: Brake pedal feels hard or spongy
and power assist brake system failure.

parsedComplaintsResult.impact: Improperly adjusted rear brakes can cause front brakes to overload, leading to warped front brake rotors and reduced braking performance.
The failure of the front cradle bushings can cause a loss of steering control, leading to accidents or leaving the driver stranded.
symptoms: loud bang when overdrive is initiated
brake rotor hot enough to burn flat spots on fingertips.

parsedComplaintsResult.impact: The failure of the inner tie rod can cause a loss of steering control, leading to accidents or leaving the driver stranded.
symptoms: Clunking noise in the front end
tie rod breaks or comes loose

parsedComplaintsResult.impact: The failure of the rack and pinion can cause a loss of steering control, leading to accidents or leaving the driver stranded.
symptoms: premature wear on outside edges of tires.

parsedComplaintsResult.impact: The failure of the power steering can cause a loss of steering control, leading to accidents or leaving the driver stranded.
symptoms: Power steering is out or very hard to turn
especially when the car is cold

parsedComplaintsResult.impact: The failure of the steering linkage can cause a loss of steering control, leading to accidents or leaving the driver stranded.

parsedComplaintsResult.issueCategory: Fuel Injector System Failure (Fuel Rail, O-Ring, and Fuel Pressure Regulator)
parsedComplaintsResult.impact: The failure of the fuel injector system can cause fuel leaks, which can lead to engine fires, accidents, and health problems due to inhalation of fuel fumes.
symptoms: engine check light on dashboard blinking off and on
smoke emitting from under the hood
fuel pump detachment from the vehicle.

parsedComplaintsResult.issueCategory: Fuel Line Failure (Fuel Line Hoses, Fuel Connector)
parsedComplaintsResult.impact: The failure of the fuel line can cause fuel leaks, which can lead to engine fires, accidents, and health problems due to inhalation of fuel fumes.
symptoms: fuel line hoses disconnected from the engine
fuel spilling into the engine area.

parsedComplaintsResult.issueCategory: Failure to Repair under Recall (Fuel Injector System, Fuel Rail)
parsedComplaintsResult.impact: The failure to repair the fuel injector system under recall can lead to continued fuel leaks, engine fires, accidents, and health problems due to inhalation of fuel fumes.
symptoms: engine check light on dashboard blinking off and on
smoke emitting from under the hood.
